Content.Knowledge Point: The importance of mood boards and visual references in online shopping
Content.Text: Creating a mood board helps you visualize your desired aesthetic and makes it easier to shop online. Refer to the mood board while shopping to ensure items align with your desired style.

Content.Knowledge Point: Buying two sizes for better fit
Content.Text: When shopping online, buy two sizes of items you like to ensure you get the right fit. Try them on and keep the one that fits best.
Use filters, keywords, and specific brand searches to narrow down your options. Edit your cart to keep only the items that align with your desired aesthetic.

Content.Knowledge Point: Utilizing department stores and personal shoppers
Content.Text: Department stores offer a variety of brands and styles. Ask sales associates for help and consider using personal shopper services to find items that fit your aesthetic.

Content.Knowledge Point: The importance of trying jeans in person
Content.Text: When shopping for jeans, try them on in person to ensure the fit is comfortable and aligns with your style. Don't rely solely on online shopping for jeans.

Content.Knowledge Point: Finding affordable and unique clothing options
Content.Text: Supermarkets, thrift stores, and independent brands can offer affordable and unique clothing options. Research online and explore different stores to find items that fit your aesthetic.

Content.Knowledge Point: Understanding the difference between public and private style
Content.Text: Influencers and celebrities often borrow designer items for public events, but their regular style may be more similar to yours. Don't feel pressured to live in designer clothing.
